subject: Design
title: The Three-Point Seatbelt: A Gift to Humanity
description: A fast breakdown of The Three-Point Seatbelt: A Gift to Humanity for builders.

hook.text: Volvo engineer Nils Bohlin invented the three-point seatbelt in 1959 â€” and Volvo gave the patent away for free.

buildup.text: Early lap belts caused internal injuries in crashes. Bohlin's Y-shaped design spread force across chest and hips.

discovery.text: Volvo made the patent open so every car manufacturer could use it. Saving lives mattered more than profit.

twist.text: The seatbelt has saved over 1 million lives since invention â€” more than almost any other single design.

climax.text: Bohlin's design shows that the greatest industrial design solves life-or-death problems elegantly.

punchline.text: The most important product design of the 20th century was given away.

quiz.question: Why did Volvo give away the seatbelt patent?
options: They wanted to save lives across all car brands
